intro: Pinalia bengkulensis, commonly known as the Bengkulu pinalia, is a unique flowering plant native to the humid lowland forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, moist environments and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
